com.dotmarketing.business

Class RoleAPIImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dotmarketing.business.RoleAPIImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RoleAPI

    public class RoleAPIImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements RoleAPI
    Author:
    Jason Tesser RoleAPI is an API intended to be a helper class for class to get Role entities. Classes within the dotCMS should use this API for role management.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.dotmarketing.business.RoleAPI

        DEFAULT_USER_ROLE_KEY, SYSTEM_ROOT_ROLE_KEY, USERS_ROOT_ROLE_KEY, WORKFLOW_ADMIN_ROLE_KEY

      • findRolesByNameFilter

                                         int start,
                                         int limit)
                                           throws DotDataException
        Description copied from interface: RoleAPI
        This method returns a list of roles whose names are like the string passed in.
        Specified by:
        findRolesByNameFilter in interface RoleAPI
        Parameters:
        filter - compare string
        start - First element to display. For a negative value, zero is assumed.
        limit - Max number of elements to show. For a negative value, zero is assumed.
        Returns:
        List of Role entities.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • findRolesByFilterLeftWildcard

        public java.util.List<Role> findRolesByFilterLeftWildcard(java.lang.String filter,
                                                 int start,
                                                 int limit)
                                                   throws DotDataException
        Description copied from interface: RoleAPI
        This method returns a list of roles whose names are like the string passed in. Left wildcarded, so "John S" would match "John Smith" but not "Mr. John Smith"
        Specified by:
        findRolesByFilterLeftWildcard in interface RoleAPI
        Parameters:
        filter - compare string
        start - First element to display. For a negative value, zero is assumed.
        limit - Max number of elements to show. For a negative value, zero is assumed.
        Returns:
        List of Role entities.
        Throws:
        DotDataException

      • delete

        public void delete(Role role)
            throws DotDataException,
                   DotStateException
        Description copied from interface: RoleAPI
        Removes a given Role.
        In order to remove a Role it is required first to remove the association of this Role with any user under it, remove its permissions and finally remove its layouts.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface RoleAPI
        Throws:
        DotDataException
        DotStateException

      • findRootRoles

        public java.util.List<Role> findRootRoles()
                                   throws DotDataException
        Description copied from interface: RoleAPI
        Find all top level roles excluding the role key RoleAPI.USERS_ROOT_ROLE_KEY (cms_users). The cms_users is the place holder for user roles and is not typically needed for the pull of root roles this method will hit the database
        Specified by:
        findRootRoles in interface RoleAPI
        Returns:
        Throws:
        DotDataException
